text: United Torah Judaism (Hebrew Yahadut HaTorah HaMeuhedet, : יהדות התורה המאוחדת), shorthanded UTJ, is a political party in Israel. ==Ideology== Its ideology is conservative, and Ashkenazic Haredi Judaism. UTJ's political leaders are Ya'akov Litzman (Agudat Yisrael) and Moshe Gafni (Degel HaTorah). Yahadut HaTorah was founded in 1992. It is an alliance of two parties: Agudat Yisrael (Union of Israel, associated with Hasidism) and Degel HaTorah (Banner of the Torah associated with Misnagdim). ==Today== Number of seats in the 24th Knesset: 7. Participating in the Fourth Netanyahu Government and the Netanyahu-Gantz Government. ==Other websites== * Yahadut HaTorah HaMeuhedet on the Knesset Website Category:Judaism in Israel Category:Political parties in Israel Category:1992 establishments in Israel
title: United Torah Judaism
